resources.string: King Abdul Aziz Road | the intersection with King Abdullah Road
As soon as you take your first step into Hayat Mall, you will be surprised with the atmosphere combines comfort, shopping, fun, and peace.
King Abdulaziz Road, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
Sahara Mall is well known to contain wide indoor pedestrian areas and spacious surrounding parking places.
King Fahad Road, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
Besides the shopping mall, Kingdom Tower contains the Four Seasons Hotel Riyadh and apartments. There is a 56 m (184 ft) skybridge atop the skyscraper.
6628 Al Amin Abdullah Al Ali Al Naeem Street, Al Malaz، Al Malaz, Riyadh 12836

Stretched out over 318,000 square meters, the new King Abdullah Malaz Park (KAMP) is the largest park of it’s kind in the Kingdom. Located in the Al-Malaz District near Prince Faisal bin Fahd Stadium, the park literally is a breath of fresh air!
The Salam Park in Riyadh is considered to be one of the biggest parks in the city and is an ideal location for people looking to spend some quality time with family and kids.
King Fahad Road, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia\n"
The green landscapes are a place for tranquility and relaxation. Yet a meeting place for friends –a community center with a family atmosphere.
AboBakr AlSiddeeq Street | Al Nuzhah Area, Riyadh 11464, Saudi Arabia\n

Serving Lebanese and American food, Al-Najdiyah Village is a favourite restaurant with tourists in Riyadh. Diners relax on large cushions on the floor, and enjoy traditional Nadji dishes in an authentic Bedouin atmosphere. The restaurant is open to women and families on Fridays only, so booking ahead for those days is essential.
Abdul Aziz Bin Museod Bin Julowi Street | District Al-Rahmaniyah\n

Serving Lebanese and American food, Al-Najdiyah Village is a favourite restaurant with tourists in Riyadh. Diners relax on large cushions on the floor, and enjoy traditional Nadji dishes in an authentic Bedouin atmosphere. The restaurant is open to women and families on Fridays only, so booking ahead for those days is essential.
The National Museum of Saudi Arabia is a major national museum in Saudi Arabia. Established in 1999, it is part of the King Abdulaziz Historical Centre in Riyadh.
King Faisal Road, Al Murabba, Riyadh 12631

The King Abdul Aziz Historical Centre is a region in the city of Riyadh, the capital of Saudi Arabia. It is not the \"historic center\" of the city as this lies to the south around Masmak fort and the main Friday Mosque\" in the Dira district.
Al Futah Riyadh 12632 3471 Al Batha, Al Futah, Riyadh 12632 3471
The Masmak is a clay and mud-brick fort, with four watchtowers and thick walls, founded on stone blocks, lying in the center of Riyadh, in the old quarters.
